intro: Cienfuegosia argentina, commonly known as the Argentine cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native range.
